A certain sum of money becomesRs.28,800 in 2 years at 20% per annum of compound interest (Compounded annually). The sum of money is:
  • A.Rs. 24,000
  • B.Rs. 22,000
  • C.Rs. 21,000
  • D.Rs. 20,000
Correct Answer: Rs. 24,000
  • Let P be the Principal.
  • Then, 28800 = P (1 + 0.2)2

or P = 288001.44 = 20,000

Question 37
One of the subjectsnottaught at ancientNalandaUniversity was:
  • A.Astronomy
  • B.Chemistry
  • C.Metaphysics
  • D.Mathematics
Correct Answer: Chemistry

Established around the 5th century CE, Nalanda University provided education on a variety of subjects that went beyond religious teachings. Students at Nalanda studied a broad range of disciplines, including philosophy, medicine, mathematics, astronomy, and logic, reflecting a secular or non-religious approach to education alongside Buddhist teachings.

Question 38
Which of the following is true about over fertile lake?
  • A.Nitrate level decreases
  • B.Depletion in algal productivity
  • C.Oxygen level increases
  • D.Quality of fishes produced is impaired.
Correct Answer: Quality of fishes produced is impaired.

Over-fertilization of lakes, often due to excessive nutrient input (particularly nitrogen and phosphorus from agricultural runoff), leads to eutrophication. This process increases algae growth, which can result in harmful algal blooms. When algae die, they decompose, consuming oxygen in the water and creating low-oxygen (hypoxic) conditions. These conditions are harmful to fish and other aquatic organisms, affecting their health, survival rates, and the quality of fish produced. Therefore, over-fertilization impairs the quality of fish in affected lakes.

Question 39
‘Code numbers given to the religion of persons’is an example of data on which of the following scales of measurement?
  • A.nominal
  • B.ordinal
  • C.interval
  • D.ratio
Correct Answer: nominal

The correct answer is option (A) - nominal.

  •  

The nominal scale is used for categorizing data without any order or ranking. When assigning code numbers to represent religions, these numbers serve merely as labels or identifiers for different categories (religions) without implying any quantitative value or order. Thus, this type of data is on a nominal scale, as it only classifies or names categories.

Question 40
Which of the following statements are true regarding the word ‘God’?A. It is meaninglessB. It is meaningfulC. The word God has no intension that could be its meaning.D. In case of word ‘God’, there is an intension that is its meaning.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B and D only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.A only
  • D.B only
Correct Answer: B and D only

The word "God" is considered meaningful (statement B), as it represents a concept or being with specific attributes, often defined within religious, philosophical, or cultural frameworks. Additionally, intension refers to the internal content or attributes associated with a term that give it meaning. In the case of "God," there is an intension—such as omnipotence, omniscience, and omnipresence—that defines the concept, thus making statement D correct.

Question 41
Which of the following statements about spreadsheet software (MS-EXCEL) are true?A. Data in spreadsheets are always correct.B. Spreadsheet software cannot draw bar graphs.C. Spread sheet software automatically recalculates.D. Some cells in a spreadsheet can be locked to prevent a user changing its contents.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B only
  • B.C and D only
  • C.A and C only
  • D.B and D only
Correct Answer: C and D only
  • Option B is the correct answer.
  •  

Statement C is true because spreadsheet software like MS Excel automatically recalculates formulas and values in cells when the data they reference changes.

  •  

Statement D is also true, as Excel allows certain cells to be locked to prevent unauthorized or accidental modification, which is useful for protecting specific data.

Question 42
In a school, there were 1582 students and the ratio of the number of the boys and girls was4 :3. After few days, 30 girls joined the school but few boys left the school and as a result, the ratio of the boys and girls became7 :6. The numberof boys who left the school is:
  • A.84
  • B.74
  • C.86
  • D.78
Correct Answer: 78
  • Start with 1582 students in the school, with a boy-to-girl ratio of 4:3.
  •  
  • Divide 1582 by the sum of the ratio parts (7), giving 226 as the multiplier.
  •  
  • Calculate initial boys and girls:
  •  
  • Boys = 4 × 226 = 904
  • Girls = 3 × 226 = 678
  •  
  • After 30 girls joined, the number of girls became 708.
  •  
  • Let the number of boys who left be y. The new ratio of boys to girls is 7:6.
  •  
  • Using proportionality between (904 − y) boys and 708 girls, we find that
  •  

y = 78

Question 43
Match theList-IwithList-II.List I (Communication Noise)A. SemanticB. PhysicalC.PsychologicalD.PhysiologicalList II (Description)I.Exists outside of the receiverII. Communicator’s prejudices and biases towards another personIII.The biological influence on the communication processIV.Linguistic influence on message receptionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • B.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
  • C.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • D.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • The correct answer is option (C) - A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  •  
  • A. Semantic Noise - IV. Linguistic influence on message reception
  • Semantic noise refers to misunderstandings caused by language differences, jargon, or ambiguity in meaning, which affects how the message is received.
  •  
  • B. Physical Noise - I. Exists outside of the receiver
  • Physical noise includes external sounds or environmental factors that interfere with communication, like loud sounds or other distractions around the receiver.
  •  
  • C. Psychological Noise - II. Communicator’s prejudices and biases towards another person
  • Psychological noise involves mental biases, attitudes, or emotions that affect the communicator's and receiver's interpretation of the message.

 

D. Physiological Noise - III. The biological influence on the communication process

Physiological noise refers to physical conditions, such as fatigue or illness, within the communicator or receiver that hinder effective communication.

Question 44
In non-verbal communication, a symbol representing an object is known as:
  • A.Identify symbol
  • B.Explanatory symbol
  • C.Animated symbol
  • D.Concrete symbol
Correct Answer: Concrete symbol

In non-verbal communication, a concrete symbol is a sign or symbol that represents an actual object or something tangible. Concrete symbols help to clearly convey the intended object or meaning without ambiguity. For instance, an icon of a house on a map is a concrete symbol representing a real, physical house. This differs from abstract symbols, which represent concepts or ideas that are not physical.

Question 45
A security system used a camera to capture images of each person entering a gift shop. Each image taken requires 1 MB of storage. If the camera captures an image every 5 seconds over a 24-hour of period, how much storage is required?
  • A.16.875 GB
  • B.15.250 GB
  • C.12.525 GB
  • D.19.625 GB
Correct Answer: 16.875 GB
  • Total seconds in 24 hours = 24 × 60 × 60 = 86,400 seconds.
  •  
  • Images taken every 5 seconds, so number of images = 86,400 ÷ 5 = 17,280 images.
  •  
  • Each image requires 1 MB, so total storage needed = 17,280 × 1 MB = 17,280 MB.
  •  
  • Convert to GB: 17,280 ÷ 1024 = 16.875 GB.

 

Answer: 16.875 GB

Question 46
Read the passage carefully and answer thefollowingquestion:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown. The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size also is due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain's development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.Which of the following facts regarding synaptic connections are correct?A. Connections that are used are weakened.B. Twice as many connections are made than ever will be used.C. Unused connections either disappear or are replaced by other pathways.D. Connections that are used perish.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and D only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A and D only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B and C only

The passage indicates that "nearly twice as many connections are made than ever will be used" (Statement B) and that "unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear" (Statement C).

Question 47
Read the passage carefully and answer thefollowingquestion:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown. The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size also is due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain's development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.Synapses are considered as:
  • A.Timely gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made.
  • B.An element responsible for blood circulation in the brain.
  • C.Large gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made.
  • D.One and only particle of the brain related to hand-eye-coordination.
Correct Answer: Timely gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made.

The passage defines synapses as "tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made," aligning directly with option (A). This describes their role in neural communication without associating them with blood circulation or hand-eye coordination directly.

Question 48
Read the passage carefully and answer thefollowingquestion:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown. The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size also is due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain's development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.As children grow their attention span focus:
  • A.Remains static
  • B.Improves
  • C.Declines insignificantly
  • D.Declines significantly
Correct Answer: Improves

The passage states that children's ability to focus and maintain attention improves as they progress through the elementary school years, which supports option (B).

Question 49
Read the passage carefully and answer thefollowingquestion:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown. The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size also is due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain's development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.Whichof the following facts aboutMyelinationare correct?A. It increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system.B. It is responsible for increase in size of the brain.C. It is completed in all areas of the brain by age four.D. Knowledge about it dies not benefit us in any way.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.C and D only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A and B only
  • D.A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A and B only

Myelination increases the speed of information transfer through the nervous system and contributes to brain growth, making statements A and B correct. However, myelination in various brain areas is not complete by age four, and knowledge about myelination has valuable implications, especially in education.

Question 50
Read the passage carefully and answer thefollowingquestion:Until recently, little was known for certain about how the brain changes as children age and grow. Considerable progress is being made in charting developmental changes in the brain, although much is still unknown. The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence. Some of the brain's increase in size also is due to myelination, a process in which many cells of the brain and nervous system are covered with an insulating layer of fat cells. This increases the speed at which information travels through the nervous system. Myelination in the areas of the brain related to hand-eye co-ordination is not complete until about four years of age. Myelination in brain areas that are important in focusing attention is not complete until the end of the elementary school years. The implications for teaching are that the children will have more difficulty focusing their attention and maintaining it for very long in early childhood but their attention will improve as they move through the elementary school years. Even in elementary school and later, many educators believe occasional short breaks sustain children's energy and motivation to learn.Another important aspect of the brain's development at the cellular level is the dramatic increase in connections between neurons (nerve cells).Synapses are tiny gaps between neurons where connections between neurons are made. Researchers have discovered an interesting aspect of synaptic connections. Nearly twice as many of these connections are made than ever will be used.The connections that are used become strengthened and will survive, while the unused ones will be replaced by other pathways or disappear.The number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow till:
  • A.Elementary school years
  • B.Early childhood
  • C.Adulthood
  • D.Adolescence
Correct Answer: Adolescence

The passage states that the number and size of the brain's nerve endings continue to grow at least until adolescence, indicating that this growth period extends through childhood and into the adolescent years.

Quiz Attempt #119729

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the income and expenditure (in ₹ millions) of a certain company during the 5 years from 2018-2022 along with profit % and loss % incurred in all these years. Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Year-wise Income, Expenditure and Profit/Loss of a CompanyYearExpenditure(in ₹ millions)Income(in ₹ millions)Profit % (+)/ Loss % (-)2018192-+ 15%2019248--2020210-+ 20%2021-359.6-2022---12%Profit in 2020 is ____________ % more than in 2018:
  • A.56.76
  • B.44.98
  • C.45.83
  • D.59. 82
Correct Answer: 45.83

Income in 2018 = 192 (1.15) = 220.8

Profit in 2018 = 220.8 – 192 = 28.8

Income in 2020 = 210 (1.20) = 252

Profit in 2020 = 252 – 210 = 42

Required percentage = 42-28.828.8 × 100 = 45.83

Question 2
Which ofthe following are the components of pedagogical analysis of teaching and learning?A. Objective formulationB. Selection of teaching methods and materialsC. Content analysisD. Selection of evaluation devices.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, C and D only
  • B.A and D only
  • C.A, B, C and D
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

All of the provided options are components of pedagogical analysis of teaching and learning:

A. Objective formulation: This component entails defining clear and specific learning objectives or goals that learners are expected to achieve through the teaching and learning process.

B. Selection of teaching methods and materials: This involves choosing appropriate instructional strategies, techniques, and resources that align with the defined learning objectives and cater to the needs and preferences of the learners.

C. Content analysis: This component involves analyzing and organizing the subject matter or content that needs to be taught. It includes breaking down complex topics into manageable units and sequencing them in a logical manner to facilitate effective learning.

D. Selection of evaluation devices: This entails determining the methods and tools that will be used to assess learners' progress and attainment of the defined learning objectives. Evaluation devices may include tests, quizzes, projects, presentations, or other forms of assessment.

Question 3
The following table shows the income and expenditure (in ₹ millions) of a certain company during the 5 years from 2018-2022 along with profit % and loss % incurred in all these years. Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Year-wise Income, Expenditure and Profit/Loss of a CompanyYearExpenditure(in ₹ millions)Income(in ₹ millions)Profit % (+)/ Loss % (-)2018192-+ 15%2019248--2020210-+ 20%2021-359.6-2022---12%In2022, if the expenditure of company was 15% more as compared to 2019, then the income of the company in 2022 was (in ₹ millions):
  • A.250.976
  • B.248.976
  • C.250.936
  • D.230.936
Correct Answer: 250.976

Expenditure in 2022 = 248 (1.15) = 285.2

Income of the company = 285.2 (0.88) = 250.976

Question 4
The following table shows the income and expenditure (in ₹ millions) of a certain company during the 5 years from 2018-2022 along with profit % and loss % incurred in all these years. Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Year-wise Income, Expenditure and Profit/Loss of a CompanyYearExpenditure(in ₹ millions)Income(in ₹ millions)Profit % (+)/ Loss % (-)2018192-+ 15%2019248--2020210-+ 20%2021-359.6-2022---12%If the loss incurred by the company in 2019 was ₹33.2 million more than the profit of the company in 2018, then the loss percent incurred by the company in 2019 was:
  • A.17%
  • B.22%
  • C.25%
  • D.23%
Correct Answer: 25%

Income in 2018 = 192 1.15 = 220.8

Profit = 220.8 – 192 = 28.8

Loss in 2019 = 28.8 + 33.20 = 62

Income in 2019 = 248 – 62 = 186

Loss % = 25%

Question 5
The following table shows the income and expenditure (in ₹ millions) of a certain company during the 5 years from 2018-2022 along with profit % and loss % incurred in all these years. Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Year-wise Income, Expenditure and Profit/Loss of a CompanyYearExpenditure(in ₹ millions)Income(in ₹ millions)Profit % (+)/ Loss % (-)2018192-+ 15%2019248--2020210-+ 20%2021-359.6-2022---12%In2021, if the profit percent (%) of the company was higher by 60% of the profit percent (%) in 2018, then the percent increase (approximately) in the expenditure of the company in 2021 as compared to the previous year would be:
  • A.46%
  • B.45%
  • C.41%
  • D.38%
Correct Answer: 38%

In 2021, the profit percent = 15 × 160100 = 24%

Expenditure = 3591.24 = 290 million

Required percentage = 290-210210 × 100 ≈ 38%

Question 6
The following table shows the income and expenditure (in ₹ millions) of a certain company during the 5 years from 2018-2022 along with profit % and loss % incurred in all these years. Some values are missing in the table (indicated by ‘-‘) that you are expected to calculate if required. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Year-wise Income, Expenditure and Profit/Loss of a CompanyYearExpenditure(in ₹ millions)Income(in ₹ millions)Profit % (+)/ Loss % (-)2018192-+ 15%2019248--2020210-+ 20%2021-359.6-2022---12%What is the average of the income of the company in 2018 and 2020 (in ₹ millions)?
  • A.220.8
  • B.236.4
  • C.252.2
  • D.246.6
Correct Answer: 236.4

Income in 2018 = 192 (1.15) = 220.8

Income in 2020 = 210 (1.20) = 252

Average = 220.8+2522 = 236.4

Question 7
Theorganized bodies of information stored in memory that bias the way new information is interpreted, stored, and recalled is known as:
  • A.Constructive process
  • B.Schemas
  • C.Chunks
  • D.Association
Correct Answer: Schemas

Schemas refer to organized bodies of information stored in memory that influence the way new information is interpreted, stored, and recalled. They guide our expectations and perceptions about the world around us, shaping how we process and remember information.

Question 8
Given below are two statements:Statement I:In teacher centred learning the teacher gives up the traditional decision-making role and chooses instead the role of a facilitator who focuses on students feelings.Statement II:In learner centred method the teacher attempts to see the world as the students see it, creating an atmosphere of empathetic communication.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.

Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.

 

Statement I describe an incorrect understanding of teacher-centered learning. In traditional teacher-centered learning, the teacher typically maintains a central role in decision-making and may not necessarily focus primarily on students' feelings.

 

Statement II accurately describes learner-centered methods, where the teacher aims to understand students' perspectives and fosters empathetic communication to create a conducive learning environment.

Question 9
Given beloware two statements:Statement I:The ability to generate unusual, yet appropriate responses to problems or questions is known as convergent thinking.Statement II:The ability to produce responses that are based primarily on knowledge and logic is known as divergent thinking.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.

Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.

 

Statement I inaccurately describe convergent thinking. Convergent thinking, which is thinking in which a problem is viewed as having a single answer and which produces responses that are based primarily on knowledge and logic.

 

Statement II inaccurately defines divergent thinking, Divergent thinking, which is a thinking that generates unusual, yet appropriate, responses to problems or questions.

Question 10
Given beloware two statements: one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).Assertion (A):No test provides a perfect picture of a student’s abilities and skills.Reason (R):A test is only one small sample of student’s performance.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of A.
  • B.Both (A) and (R) are correct, but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
  • C.(A) is correct, but (R) is not correct.
  • D.(A) is not correct, but (R) is correct.
Correct Answer: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of A.

Assertion (A) correctly states that no test can provide a perfect representation of a student's abilities and skills. Tests have limitations and may only capture a small aspect of a student's overall performance.

Reason (R) provides an explanation for Assertion (A), stating that a test is just one sample of a student's performance and may not fully reflect their abilities across various contexts or situations. Therefore, (R) supports and explains (A).

Question 11
Anepistemological position that advocates the application of the methods of the natural sciences to the study of social reality and beyond refers to:
  • A.Positivism
  • B.Interpretivism
  • C.Objectivism
  • D.Constructivism
Correct Answer: Positivism

Positivism is an epistemological position that advocates for the application of the methods of the natural sciences, such as observation, experimentation, and quantification, to the study of social reality and beyond. Positivists believe in the objective existence of social phenomena that can be studied using empirical methods, aiming for objective and value-free knowledge.

Question 12
Identify the similarities between quantitative and qualitative research:A. Both are concerned with data reduction.B. Both are concerned with variation in data.C. Both lay emphasis on contextual understanding.D. Both lay emphasis on generalization.E. Both are concerned with answering research questions.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and D only
  • B.A, B, D and E only
  • C.B, D and E only
  • D.A, B and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and E only

The correct answer is option D.

 

Both quantitative and qualitative research are concerned with data reduction (option A) as they involve organizing and summarizing large amounts of data.

 

They are both concerned with variation in data (option B), as both types of research aim to understand patterns and differences in data.

 

Both quantitative and qualitative research are concerned with answering research questions (option E), as they seek to address specific inquiries or explore phenomena of interest.

 

However, qualitative research typically emphasizes contextual understanding (option C) rather than generalization (option D), which is more common in quantitative research.

Question 13
Identify the correct reasons for writing a literature review:A. You need to know what is already known in connection with your research area.B. It may help you to develop an analytic framework.C. It will help with the interpretation of your findings.D. It may suggest further research questions for you.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A, C and D only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

Writing a literature review is important because it helps you understand what is already known in connection with your research area (option A).

It may help you develop an analytic framework (option B) by providing insights into existing theories, concepts, and methodologies.

A literature review aids in the interpretation of your findings (option C) by providing context and comparing your results with existing research.

It may also suggest further research questions for you (option D) by identifying gaps or areas needing more exploration within the existing literature.

Therefore, option (D) includes all the correct reasons for writing a literature review.

Question 14
Identify the sampling issues that are problematic in online survey:A. Many people use more than one internet service provider.B. Every person has only one (unique) email address.C. A household may have one computer, but several users.D. Internet users are a biased sample of the population.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A, B and D only
  • D.A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only

The correct answer is option (D) i.e., A, C, and D only.

 

Many people use more than one internet service provider (option A), which can affect the representativeness of the sample and introduce bias.

 

A household may have one computer, but several users (option C), leading to potential bias in the responses collected.

 

Internet users are a biased sample of the population (option D) because not everyone has access to the internet, which can lead to underrepresentation of certain demographic groups and skew the results.

 

Therefore, option (D) includes the sampling issues that are problematic in online surveys.

Question 15
Which amongthe following is an open-source software for data analysis?
  • A.SPSS
  • B.MATLAB
  • C.R
  • D.MINITAB
Correct Answer: R

Option C is correct.

R is an open-source programming language and software environment specifically designed for statistical computing and graphics. It is widely used by statisticians, data analysts, researchers, and scientists for data analysis, visualization, and modeling. Being open-source means that the source code of R is freely available to the public, allowing users to modify, redistribute, and extend the software according to their needs.

Question 16
When the primary function of communication is to convey new information, it is known as:
  • A.Subliminal function
  • B.Single task function
  • C.Referential function
  • D.Differential function
Correct Answer: Referential function

The referential function of communication focuses on conveying new information or referring to objects, events, or ideas in the external world. This function is about providing facts, descriptions, or explanations, rather than expressing emotions or socializing.

Question 17
One ofthe four maxims of conversation, quantity maxim reflects the right amount of:
  • A.Paradigms
  • B.Syntagms
  • C.Similes
  • D.Information
Correct Answer: Information

The conversation maxims are popularly known as Grice's Maxims, proposed by the philosopher H.P. Grice in his work on the cooperative principle and conversational implicature.

 

Grice identified the following 4 conversational maxims that guide effective communication during interactions.

1. The maxim of quantity, where one tries to be as informative as one possibly can, and gives as much information as is needed, and no more. For example, I'm going to the store to buy groceries, including apples, bananas, and oranges."

 

2. The maxim of quality, where one tries to be truthful, and does not give information that is false or that is not supported by evidence. For example, "The Earth orbits the Sun."

 

3. The maxim of relation, where one tries to be relevant, and says things that are pertinent to the discussion. For example, "Regarding your question about the meeting agenda, here's the proposed schedule for discussion."

 

4. The maxim of manner, when one tries to be as clear, as brief, and as orderly as one can in what one says, and where one avoids obscurity and ambiguity. For example, "Please summarize your findings in three concise points for the presentation."

Question 18
Which of the following contextual factors determine meaning in communication behaviour?A. Physical locationB. ParticipantsC. Preceding eventsD.NonfunctionalgoalsE. Absence of audienceChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

Communication may vary according to the situation and context in which it is spoken. Situational and contextual issues include occasion, purpose, spatial position of participants, previous actions and speaker’s role in two-person interaction.

 

The context in which communication occurs, including the physical environment or location, can significantly influence the interpretation of messages and the behavior of participants. Therefore, physical location is a relevant contextual factor.

 

The individuals involved in communication interaction play a crucial role in determining meaning through their roles, perspectives, and behaviors. Thus, the participants are another important contextual factor.

 

Previous actions, conversations, or events can shape the context and influence the interpretation of current communication behavior by providing background information and expectations. Therefore, preceding events are also a significant contextual factor.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option A.

Question 19
Which ofthe following belong to the field of proxemics in communication?A. Facial ExpressionsB. CrowdingC. TerritorialityD. Personal spaceE. Eye ContactChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

Facial Expressions (option A) and Eye Contact (option E) are aspects of nonverbal communication but are not specifically related to the field of proxemics.

 

Crowding (option B), Territoriality (option C), and Personal space (option D) are concepts within proxemics, which is the study of how humans use space and distance to communicate. These concepts focus on the spatial relationships between individuals and their surroundings. Therefore, option (B) includes the elements that belong to the field of proxemics in communication.

Question 20
Givenbelow are two statements:Statement I:According to Buddhism, linguistic communication should be used to adopt moral stance.Statement II:Critical introspection is not preferred by Buddhist as part of intra-personal communication.In the light of above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the questions given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.

Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.

 

Statement I correctly reflect a principle in Buddhism where linguistic communication is valued for adopting a moral stance, as words can have a significant impact on moral conduct and relationships.

 

Statement II, however, is incorrect. Critical introspection and self-reflection are valued in Buddhism as part of intra-personal communication. Buddhism emphasizes the importance of understanding one's own mind and emotions through practices such as meditation and mindfulness. Therefore, statement II does not align with Buddhist principles.

Question 21
In an arithmetic series having 50 terms, the first and last terms are 3 and 199 respectively. What is the sum of the series?
  • A.4950
  • B.5050
  • C.5150
  • D.4850
Correct Answer: 5050

a + 49 d = 199

or 3 + 49d = 199

or d = 4

Sum of series = 5022×3+49d

= 5050

Question 22
Find the next term (?) in the following letters series AM, GJ, MG, SD, ?………..
  • A.XZ
  • B.YC
  • C.XA
  • D.YA
Correct Answer: YA

A + 5 = G and M – 2 = J

G + 5 = M and J – 2 = G

M + 5 = S, G – 2 = D

Similarly,

S + 5 = Y and D – 2 = A

Next term will be YA.

Question 23
The sum and difference of two numbers are 19 and 7 respectively. What is the sum of their squares?
  • A.190
  • B.200
  • C.205
  • D.210
Correct Answer: 205

Let two numbers be a and b

a + b = 19 -----(i)

And a – b = 7 ----(ii)

Solving equation (i) and (ii), we get

a = 13 and b = 6

a2 + b2 = (13)2 + (6)2 = 205

Question 24
A certain sum of money doubles in 4 years at a compound rate of interest per annum. The rate of interest is [Given;212=1.414,214=1.1892]
  • A.~14.9%
  • B.~16.8%
  • C.~18.9%
  • D.~12.9%
Correct Answer: ~18.9%

Let P be the principal and R be the rate of interest.

Then, 2P = P (1+R100)4

or 1+R100 = 21/4 = 1.1892

or R100 = 0.1892

or R = 18.92%

Question 25
A train movingat a speed of 63 km/hrenters the railway station and crosses the platform in 20 sec. If the length of the train is 100 m, what is the length of the platform?
  • A.150 m
  • B.200 m
  • C.250 m
  • D.300 m
Correct Answer: 250 m

Speed of the train = 63 km/hr = 704 m/sec

Let the length of the platform be x meters.

Then, x+100704 = 20

or x = 250 m

Question 26
As persquare of opposition which of the following propositions are so related that if one of them is true, the other must be false, and vice-versa?A. All mammals are vertebrates.B. No mammals are vertebrates.C. Some non-mammals are not vertebrates.D. Some mammals are not vertebrates.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and D only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.A and B only
  • D.C and D only
Correct Answer: A and D only

Proposition ‘A’ and Preposition ‘O’ are contradictory. Therefore correct answer is option A.

Question 27
Which of the following statements are logically equivalent?A. No liquids are beveragesB. No beverages are liquidsC. All non-beverages are non-liquidsD. All non-liquids are non-beveragesChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B only
  • B.A and C only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.C and D only
Correct Answer: A and B only

Statement B is conversion of Statement A.

Question 28
If the statement “Some rectangles are not squares” is given as true, then according to the square of opposition which of the following statements can be immediately inferred to be false?
  • A.All rectangles are squares.
  • B.Somerectanglesare squares.
  • C.No rectangles are squares.
  • D.Some squares are not rectangles
Correct Answer: All rectangles are squares.

If Proposition ‘O’ is true, then Preposition ‘A’ is false.

Question 29
“More lawshave been added on the books in past five years than ever before, yet the number of crimes committed during the same period has significantly increased. Therefore, to bring the crime rate down, we must eliminate the laws.” Which fallacy is committed in the above statement?
  • A.Red herring
  • B.Straw man
  • C.Slippery slope
  • D.False cause
Correct Answer: False cause

The argument presents a correlation between the increase in the number of laws and the increase in the number of crimes over the past five years. However, it falsely assumes a causal relationship between the two factors. Just because the number of laws has increased does not necessarily mean that these new laws have caused the increase in crime. There could be various other factors contributing to the rise in crime rates.

False Cause fallacy occurs when one event is assumed to cause another event because they are correlated in some way, without considering other possible factors or explanations. In this case, the increase in crime rates may be influenced by socioeconomic factors, changes in policing strategies, demographic shifts, or other societal issues, rather than simply the existence of more laws.

Question 30
Givenbelow are 2 statements:Statement I:According to classical Indian school of logic (Nyaya) the argument, “Sound is eternal because it is audible” is fallacious.Statement II:According to classical Indian school of logic the argument “Sound is eternal because it is audible” commits the fallacy of irregular middle term where the middle term is too wide.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer for the options given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.

Savyabhichära or Anaikäntika: This is the fallacy of the irregular middle. It is of three kinds:-

 

(a) Sädharana: Here the middle term is too wide. It is present in both the sapaksa (positive) and the vipaksa (negative) instances and violates the rule that the middle should not be present in the negative instances (vipaksäsattva); e.g., ‘the hill has fire because it is knowable’. Here ‘knowable is present in fiery as well as non-fiery objects.

(b) Asädhärana: Here the middle term is too narrow. It is present only in the paksa and neither in the sapaksa nor in the vipaksa. It violates the rule that the middle term should be present in the sapaksa (sapaksasattva); e.g., ‘sound is eternal, because it is audible. Here audibility belongs to sound only and is present nowhere else.

(c) Anupasamhäri : Here the middle term is non-exclusive. The minor term is all-inclusive and leaves nothing by way of sapaksa or vipaksa; e.g., 'all things are non-eternal, because they are knowable.

Question 31
In comparison to secondary computer storage, primary storage is:
  • A.Slower, more expensive per unit of storage and persistent
  • B.Faster, less expensive per unit of storage and persistent.
  • C.Faster, more expensive per unit of storage and not persistent
  • D.Faster, less expensive per unit of storage and not persistent.
Correct Answer: Faster, more expensive per unit of storage and not persistent

Primary storage is faster than secondary storage. It allows the CPU to access data quickly, which is crucial for running applications and processes efficiently. Secondary storage, such as hard drives or SSDs, is slower in comparison due to the physical nature of the storage medium and the need to transfer data to and from RAM for processing.

 

Primary memory is more expensive per unit of storage compared to secondary storage.

 

The most critical difference between primary and secondary storage is persistence. Primary storage, being volatile, loses its contents when the power is turned off. This means that the data stored in RAM is only available when the computer is powered on. In contrast, secondary storage is non-volatile, meaning that data remains stored even when the power is off.

Question 32
A securitysystem records video footage. One minute of video requires 180 megabytes of storage. The recording system can store several hours of video footage. How much storage would be needed for 2 hours of video footage? (1k =1024)
  • A.19.2 Giga Bytes
  • B.20.3 Giga Bytes
  • C.21.1 Giga Bytes
  • D.22.4 Giga Bytes
Correct Answer: 21.1 Giga Bytes

1 minute of video requires 180 Mb of storage then 2 hrs (120 mins) video will require 120 mins × 180 Mb = 21600 Mb and by converting it to GB using 1k =1024 bytes we get 21.1 Gb.

Question 33
If(P)8represents the number P in base – 8, then(144)8+(175)8=
  • A.(225)8
  • B.(341)8
  • C.(441)8
  • D.(314)8
Correct Answer: (341)8

(144)8 = 4 × 80 + 4 × 81 + 1 × 82 = 100

(178)8 = 5 × 80 + 7 × 81 + 1 × 82 = 125

(144)8 + (178)8 = 100 + 125 = 225

 

Now, 2258 = 28, remainder 1

288 = 3, remainder 4

38 = 0, remainder 3

Thus, (144)8 + (178)8 = (341)8

Question 34
Given below are two statements:Statement I:IPv6 address in computer networking is 4 times larger than an IPv4 address.Statement II:The IP address gives the location of a device on the internet, whereas the MAC address identifies the device connected to the internet.
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are correct.

IPv4 (Internet Protocol version 4) addresses are 32 bits long, allowing for approximately 4.3 billion unique addresses. With the growth of the internet and the proliferation of connected devices, this limited address space became a significant constraint. IPv6 (Internet Protocol version 6) was developed to address this limitation. IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long, which is significantly larger than the 32 bits of IPv4 addresses. This expansion provides an almost limitless number of unique addresses, allowing for the continued growth of the internet and accommodating the ever-increasing number of connected devices.

 

So, IPv6 addresses are 4 times larger than IPv4 addresses in terms of bits: 128 bits for IPv6 compared to 32 bits for IPv4. Therefore, statement I is true.

 

The IP address (Internet Protocol address) serves as a unique identifier for devices connected to a network, allowing them to communicate with each other over the internet. It provides a logical address that helps in routing data packets to their intended destinations. Each device connected to a network, whether it's a computer, smartphone, or any other networked device, is assigned an IP address.

 

On the other hand, the MAC address (Media Access Control address) is a hardware address that is permanently assigned to network interfaces, such as Ethernet cards or Wi-Fi adapters. The MAC address uniquely identifies a device at the data link layer of the OSI model. It is used for communication within a local network and is not typically routed across the internet. So, statement II is correct.

Question 35
Match List-IwithList-IIList-I (Graphical user interface term)A. WindowB. IconC. MenuD. PointerList-II (Description)I. Represents a folder or a program-can be seen within a window or free standing on screen.II. Contains lists of options for a certain program.III. Used to select menu options/icons/close/open windows.IV. Represents an area on the screen that displays information for a specific program.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A-III, B-I, C-II, D-IV
  • B.A-I, B-IV, C-II, D-III
  • C.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • D.A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III

In a GUI, a window is a graphical area on the screen that displays the contents of an application or program. Windows can be resized, moved, minimized, maximized, and closed. They provide a way to interact with multiple programs simultaneously and organize information on the screen.

 

Icons are small graphical symbols that represent files, folders, programs, or actions. They are typically used to visually represent objects or actions in the user interface. Icons can be displayed within a window or as free-standing objects on the screen, such as shortcuts on the desktop.

 

A menu is a list of options or commands that are available to the user within a program. Menus can be displayed as a drop-down list, a pop-up menu, or a menu bar at the top of a window. They provide a way for users to access various functions and features of a program.

 

The pointer, often represented as a cursor on the screen, is a graphical symbol that indicates the current position of the mouse or other pointing device. The pointer is used to select menu options, click on icons, and interact with windows by opening, closing, resizing, or moving them.

Question 36
Which ofthe following are true about producer gas?A. It is the result of conversion of solid biomass into gaseous fuels.B. It is done at lower temperature.C. It can be used as fuel in internal combustion engines.D. It is produced in the complete absence of oxygen.E. Hydrogen and methane present in producer gas determine its heating value.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, C and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only

Producer gas, also known as wood gas, is a fuel gas produced by partial combustion of carbonaceous materials such as coal, wood, or biomass. It is typically used as a fuel in gas engines to generate electricity and heat. The process of producing producer gas involves passing air or oxygen through a bed of hot carbonaceous material, which results in the conversion of the material into a mixture of gases including carbon monoxide, hydrogen, and methane. These gases can be used as a fuel in various applications, including industrial heating, power generation, and as a substitute for natural gas in some settings. Producer gas has been used historically as a fuel for vehicles during fuel shortages and has regained interest as a renewable and carbon-neutral fuel source.

Question 37
The biologicaldiversity is dedicated to promote sustainable development conceived as a practical tool for translating the principles of:
  • A.Agenda 20
  • B.Agenda 21
  • C.Agenda 22
  • D.Agenda 23
Correct Answer: Agenda 21

Agenda 21 is a non-binding action plan of the United Nations (UN) related to sustainable development. It is a comprehensive blueprint of action to be taken globally, nationally, and locally by organizations of the UN, governments, and major groups in every area in which humans impact the environment.

 

Agenda 21, adopted in 1992 at the UN Conference on Environment and Development (UNCED) in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is a commitment to sustainable development that recognizes the need for a balance between economic development, social equity, and environmental protection. It addresses issues such as poverty, consumption patterns, human health, and the conservation and management of resources, aiming to guide development policies towards sustainability.

 

Agenda 21 emphasizes the importance of local action in addressing global challenges and calls for the participation of all stakeholders in sustainable development. While it is not legally binding, many countries have adopted policies and strategies based on its principles to promote sustainable development.

Question 38
What is the correct sequence of steps followed from initial to last during water treatment process?A. CoagulationB. FiltrationC. ScreeningD. SedimentationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.D, C, B, A
  • B.D, C, A, B
  • C.C, D, A, B
  • D.C, A, D, B
Correct Answer: C, A, D, B

Following are the steps in water treatment process:

 

Screening. The first step in the treatment process is to screen the water to remove larger items of suspended materials, such as rubbish, plants, trees, animals and other debris. At this point, chemicals are now added to encourage smaller particles of suspended matter to clump together and form “floc”.

 

Coagulation. After the coagulant has been added to the water, it must be mixed at varying speeds over a period of time to allow the flocs to form (this part of the process is known as flocculation).

 

Sedimentation and clarification. Once the flocs have formed, the water is passed over a sedimentation basin. Here, the clumps of floc particles can settle at the bottom of the basin, where they are removed to a disposal pond.

 

Filtration. With the larger particles taken out of the water, it must now be filtered through a variety of media such as sand, gravel or granular activated carbon to remove the smaller unwanted particles which still persist.

Question 39
Given below are twostatements: one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).Assertion (A):DDTbioaccumulatesin tissues of many species, including humans.Reason (R):DDT is relatively insoluble in water but readily soluble in fats and oils.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of A.
  • B.Both (A) and (R) are correct, but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
  • C.(A) is correct, but (R) is not correct.
  • D.(A) is not correct, but (R) is correct.
Correct Answer: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of A.

DDT (dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane) is known to bioaccumulate in the tissues of organisms. This means that it builds up in the bodies of organisms over time, particularly in fatty tissues. Therefore, assertion is correct.

DDT is relatively insoluble in water but readily soluble in fats and oils. This property allows it to accumulate in the fatty tissues of organisms, including humans, as they consume contaminated food or water. Therefore, reason is correct and explains why DDT bioaccumulates.

Question 40
Given beloware two statements:Statement I:Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) were mainly targeted at developing or poor countries.Statement II:Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are targeted at all countries, whether developed, developing, or poor.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are correct.

The Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) were a set of eight international development goals established by the United Nations in 2000. These goals were primarily targeted at developing or poor countries and aimed to address key issues such as poverty, hunger, education, gender equality, and healthcare. The MDGs were intended to be achieved by the year 2015 and focused on improving the lives of people in the world's poorest countries.

 

Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are a set of 17 global goals that were adopted by the United Nations in 2015. Unlike the MDGs, which were primarily focused on developing countries, the SDGs are targeted at all countries, including developed, developing, and poor nations. The SDGs aim to address a broader range of issues, including poverty, inequality, climate change, environmental degradation, peace, and justice.

Question 41
Which ofthe following was recommended by the Hunter Commission?
  • A.Abolition of higher education in India
  • B.Restricting women's entry into colleges
  • C.Participation of private enterprise and higher education
  • D.Encouraging establishment of more and more public universities in rural India
Correct Answer: Participation of private enterprise and higher education

The Hunter Commission, also known as the Indian Universities Commission, was appointed by the British Government in 1882 to review the state of higher education in India. One of the recommendations made by the commission was the participation of private enterprise in higher education, aiming to encourage the involvement of private individuals and organizations in establishing educational institutions and supporting education initiatives.

Question 42
The university of Punjab was established at Lahore in 1882 to reduce the burden of the university of:
  • A.Bombay
  • B.Calcutta
  • C.Madras
  • D.Himachal Pradesh
Correct Answer: Calcutta

The University of Punjab was established in 1882 in Lahore, which was then part of British India and is now located in Pakistan. The university was founded to address the growing demand for higher education in the region and to alleviate the burden on the University of Calcutta, which was the only university serving the vast area of British India at that time.

Question 43
Which ofthe following steps were taken by the University Grants Commission during the second five-year plan?A. Introduction of three-year degree course.B. Improvement in Libraries and LaboratoriesC. Increase in the salaries of university teachersD. No new departments were approved in the universities.E Hindi was made the optional medium of instruction beside local languages in all Indian universities.Choose the correct answer from the options given below.
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and C only

The first five-year plan (1951-56) stressed the significance of rebuilding higher education by streamlining the existing system, decreasing college congestion, and boosting teaching quality

 

During the second five-year plan (1956-61), the University Grants Commission identified a number of steps to be carried out in order to improve university and college educational quality and to prevent wastage among students who were not qualified. Three-year degree programs were developed, buildings, labs and libraries were renovated, and libraries were provided, dormitory facilities were provided, research funding was provided, and university faculty remuneration was increased. The second five-year plan resulted in the establishment of seven new institutions.

 

Thus, option (A) is correct.

Question 44
Which ofthe following research institutes were established between the first and third five-year plans?A. Indian Institute of ScienceB.SahaInstitute of Nuclear PhysicsC.LokBharatiD. Gandhi Gram Rural InstituteE. Raman Research InstituteChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A, D and E only
  • C.B, C and E only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B, C and D only

The first and third five-year plans ranged from 1951 to 1956 and from 1961 to 1966 respectively.

 

Following are the years of foundation or establishment for the given research institutes:

 

1. Indian Institute of Science - 1909

2. Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics – 1949 (formally opened in 1950)

3. Lok Bharati - 1953

4. Gandhi Gram Rural Institute - 1956

5. Raman Research Institute – 1948

 

Note that although the first five-year plan was launched in the year 1951, Saha Institute of Nuclear Physics was formally opened in the year 1950. The answer key to this question includes the said Institute as well.

Question 45
Given beloware two statements.Statement I:TheNalandaUniversity of Ancient India attracted students from various parts of Asia.Statement II:TheNalandaUniversity was overshadowed by the universities in Europe and Arabia immediately after its establishment.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.

Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.

 

Statement I: "The Nalanda University of Ancient India attracted students from various parts of Asia." - This statement is correct. Nalanda University was a renowned center of learning in ancient India and attracted students from various parts of Asia, including China, Korea, Japan, Tibet, Mongolia, Turkey, Sri Lanka, and Southeast Asian countries.

 

Statement II: "The Nalanda University was overshadowed by the universities in Europe and Arabia immediately after its establishment." - This statement is incorrect. Nalanda University was one of the world's first residential universities and was a prominent center of learning in ancient times. It flourished for several centuries before its decline, and it wasn't overshadowed by European or Arabian universities immediately after its establishment.

Question 46
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:The most important part of a person's life is his childhood. The learning or young citizens receive at home, in school, and in society between the ages of 5 and 16 will shape them for the rest of their lives, during this phase, they need a good value-based education to become enlightened human beings.Parents and teachers need to have an integrated mission: education with a good value system at home and in school. Education is fundamental to building the nation of our dreams. All are aspirations as a society are tied to the capabilities of our youngsters, who form such a large part of our population.A child’s individuality and creativity need to be given due importance in our education. The curriculum needs to be innovative, and the examination system overhauled so that it recognises and evaluates creativity and new thinking rather than the memorization of facts. Schools must move away from being centres of education alone, instead becoming centres of knowledge and skill development.A child becomes an enlightened human being as a result of the value-based education received:A. At home onlyB. In school onlyC. At home, in school and in societyD. In society onlyE. Between the ages of 5 and 16Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and E only
  • B.A, D and E only
  • C.C and E only
  • D.A and B only
Correct Answer: C and E only

According to the passage, a child becomes an enlightened human being as a result of the value-based education received at home, in school, and in society (option C). The passage emphasizes the importance of education with a good value system both at home and in school, highlighting the integrated mission that parents and teachers should have. Additionally, it mentions that the learning received between the ages of 5 and 16 will shape individuals for the rest of their lives (option E). Therefore, options C and E are correct.

Question 47
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:The most important part of a person's life is his childhood. The learning or young citizens receive at home, in school, and in society between the ages of 5 and 16 will shape them for the rest of their lives, during this phase, they need a good value-based education to become enlightened human beings.Parents and teachers need to have an integrated mission: education with a good value system at home and in school. Education is fundamental to building the nation of our dreams. All are aspirations as a society are tied to the capabilities of our youngsters, who form such a large part of our population.A child’s individuality and creativity need to be given due importance in our education. The curriculum needs to be innovative, and the examination system overhauled so that it recognises and evaluates creativity and new thinking rather than the memorization of facts. Schools must move away from being centres of education alone, instead becoming centres of knowledge and skill development.What is essential for building the nation of our dreams?
  • A.More schools
  • B.Value based education
  • C.Democracy
  • D.Rapid Urbanization
Correct Answer: Value based education

According to the passage, education with a good value system is fundamental to building the nation of our dreams. It emphasizes the importance of instilling values in young citizens both at home and in school. Therefore, option B i.e., Value-based education is essential for building the nation of our dreams, as stated in the passage.

Question 48
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:The most important part of a person's life is his childhood. The learning or young citizens receive at home, in school, and in society between the ages of 5 and 16 will shape them for the rest of their lives, during this phase, they need a good value-based education to become enlightened human beings.Parents and teachers need to have an integrated mission: education with a good value system at home and in school. Education is fundamental to building the nation of our dreams. All are aspirations as a society are tied to the capabilities of our youngsters, who form such a large part of our population.A child’s individuality and creativity need to be given due importance in our education. The curriculum needs to be innovative, and the examination system overhauled so that it recognises and evaluates creativity and new thinking rather than the memorization of facts. Schools must move away from being centres of education alone, instead becoming centres of knowledge and skill development.Who needs to have an integrated mission: education with a good value system at home and in school?
  • A.Politicians
  • B.Philanthropists
  • C.Parents and Teachers
  • D.Businessmen
Correct Answer: Parents and Teachers

According to the passage, parents and teachers need to have an integrated mission of education with a good value system at home and in school. They play a crucial role in shaping the education and values of young citizens. Therefore, option C, i.e., Parents and Teachers need to have an integrated mission of education with a good value system at home and in school, as stated in the passage.

Question 49
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:The most important part of a person's life is his childhood. The learning or young citizens receive at home, in school, and in society between the ages of 5 and 16 will shape them for the rest of their lives, during this phase, they need a good value-based education to become enlightened human beings.Parents and teachers need to have an integrated mission: education with a good value system at home and in school. Education is fundamental to building the nation of our dreams. All are aspirations as a society are tied to the capabilities of our youngsters, who form such a large part of our population.A child’s individuality and creativity need to be given due importance in our education. The curriculum needs to be innovative, and the examination system overhauled so that it recognises and evaluates creativity and new thinking rather than the memorization of facts. Schools must move away from being centres of education alone, instead becoming centres of knowledge and skill development.A good examination system should:A. Recognize a child’s creativity.B. Recognize a child’s individuality.C. Encourage rote learning.D. Encourage new thinking.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and D only
  • B.B and C only
  • C.A, B and C only
  • D.C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B and D only

According to the passage, a good examination system should recognize a child’s creativity (option A), recognize a child’s individuality (option B), and encourage new thinking (option D). These qualities are emphasized as important aspects of education and assessment, as opposed to encouraging rote learning (option C), which is discouraged in the passage. Therefore, options A, B, and D are correct.

Question 50
Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions:The most important part of a person's life is his childhood. The learning or young citizens receive at home, in school, and in society between the ages of 5 and 16 will shape them for the rest of their lives, during this phase, they need a good value-based education to become enlightened human beings.Parents and teachers need to have an integrated mission: education with a good value system at home and in school. Education is fundamental to building the nation of our dreams. All are aspirations as a society are tied to the capabilities of our youngsters, who form such a large part of our population.A child’s individuality and creativity need to be given due importance in our education. The curriculum needs to be innovative, and the examination system overhauled so that it recognises and evaluates creativity and new thinking rather than the memorization of facts. Schools must move away from being centres of education alone, instead becoming centres of knowledge and skill development.Given below are two statements:Statement I:Schools should only be centers of education.Statement II:Youngsters form a minimal part of our population.
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct.
Correct Answer: Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.

Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.

 

Statement I: "Schools should only be centers of education." - This statement is incorrect according to the passage. The passage suggests that schools should not just focus on education but also on knowledge and skill development, indicating a broader role beyond traditional education.

 

Statement II: "Youngsters form a minimal part of our population." - This statement is incorrect. The passage implies that youngsters form a significant part of the population, and their capabilities are crucial for the aspirations of society.

Quiz Attempt #119730

Total Questions: 50
Question 1
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of expenses in agriculture under different budget heads, namely fertilizer, feed, seed, electricity and diesel and others in the year 2012 and 2022. Total amount of expenditure incurred on all the different heads in 2012 and 2022 is ₹30864croresandRs70698croresrespectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Budget HeadYear20122022Fertilizer17.5%28.8%Feed29.5%19.5%Seed18.5%14.5%Electricity and Diesel7.8%8.6%Others26.7%28.6%The expenditure on electricity and diesel in 2022 exceeded similar expenditure in 2012 by approximately.
  • A.₹ 1840crores
  • B.₹ 1852crores
  • C.₹ 3673crores
  • D.₹ 3704crores
Correct Answer: ₹ 3673crores

Required increment = 8.6% of 70698 – 7.8% of 30864 ≈ Rs. 3673 crore

Question 2
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of expenses in agriculture under different budget heads, namely fertilizer, feed, seed, electricity and diesel and others in the year 2012 and 2022. Total amount of expenditure incurred on all the different heads in 2012 and 2022 is ₹30864croresandRs70698croresrespectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Budget HeadYear20122022Fertilizer17.5%28.8%Feed29.5%19.5%Seed18.5%14.5%Electricity and Diesel7.8%8.6%Others26.7%28.6%Theexpenditure on fertilizer in 2022 is approximately _________ times more than that in 2012.
  • A.2.77
  • B.4.63
  • C.3.52
  • D.1.55
Correct Answer: 2.77

Required times = 28.8% of 70698-17.5% of 3086417.5% of 30864 ≈ 2.77 times.

Question 3
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of expenses in agriculture under different budget heads, namely fertilizer, feed, seed, electricity and diesel and others in the year 2012 and 2022. Total amount of expenditure incurred on all the different heads in 2012 and 2022 is ₹30864croresandRs70698croresrespectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Budget HeadYear20122022Fertilizer17.5%28.8%Feed29.5%19.5%Seed18.5%14.5%Electricity and Diesel7.8%8.6%Others26.7%28.6%The expenditure on fertiliser and feed in 2012 amounted to approximately.
  • A.₹ 14506crores
  • B.₹ 16000crores
  • C.₹ 14000crores
  • D.₹ 7084crores
Correct Answer: ₹ 14506crores

Expenditure on fertiliser and feed in 2012 = 47% of 30864 ≈ 14506 crore.

Question 4
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of expenses in agriculture under different budget heads, namely fertilizer, feed, seed, electricity and diesel and others in the year 2012 and 2022. Total amount of expenditure incurred on all the different heads in 2012 and 2022 is ₹30864croresandRs70698croresrespectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Budget HeadYear20122022Fertilizer17.5%28.8%Feed29.5%19.5%Seed18.5%14.5%Electricity and Diesel7.8%8.6%Others26.7%28.6%The expenditure on feed in 2022 as compared to that in 2012, was approximately.
  • A.51% less
  • B.53% more
  • C.53% less
  • D.51% more
Correct Answer: 51% more

Expenditure on feed in 2012 = 9104.88

Expenditure on feed in 2022 = 13786.11

Percentage increment = 13786.11-9104.889104.88 × 100 ≈ 51%

Question 5
The following table shows the percentage (%) distribution of expenses in agriculture under different budget heads, namely fertilizer, feed, seed, electricity and diesel and others in the year 2012 and 2022. Total amount of expenditure incurred on all the different heads in 2012 and 2022 is ₹30864croresandRs70698croresrespectively. Based on the data in the table, answer the questions that follow.Budget HeadYear20122022Fertilizer17.5%28.8%Feed29.5%19.5%Seed18.5%14.5%Electricity and Diesel7.8%8.6%Others26.7%28.6%In terms of actual expenditure on electricity and diesel, the increase in 2022, as compared to 2012 was.
  • A.1.91 times
  • B.1.53 times
  • C.1.94 times
  • D.1.83 times
Correct Answer: 1.53 times

Required increase = 8.6% of 70698-7.8% of 308647.8% of 30864 ≈ 1.53 times

Question 6
Which ofthe following are the characteristics of a good test?A. ObjectivityB. ValidityC. ComprehensivenessD.DiagnosticityE. PracticalityChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, D and E only
  • B.A, B, C, D and E
  • C.B and D only
  • D.C and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

Option B is correct.

The characteristics of a good test are

Objectivity refers to the extent to which the scoring and interpretation of test results are free from bias or personal judgment. It ensures that the same score would be given to a particular response regardless of who scores it.

Validity refers to the extent to which a test measures what it is intended to measure. A good test should have evidence supporting its validity, indicating that it accurately assesses the construct or domain it is designed to measure.

Comprehensiveness refers to the breadth and depth of content coverage in the test. Comprehensive tests cover a wide range of topics within a domain, providing a more thorough assessment.

Diagnosticity refers to the test's ability to provide detailed information about an individual's strengths and weaknesses within the domain being assessed. A good test should not only provide an overall score but also offer insights into specific areas where improvement may be needed.

Practicality refers to the feasibility and convenience of administering, scoring, and interpreting the test within real-world constraints, such as time, resources, and administrative burden. A good test should be practical to administer and should not place undue burden on test administrators or test-takers.

Question 7
Thememory for general knowledge and facts about the world, as well as memory for the rules of logic that are used to deduce other facts, is known as.
  • A.Temporary memory
  • B.Semantic memory
  • C.Iconic memory
  • D.General memory
Correct Answer: Semantic memory

Option B is correct.

Semantic memory refers to the long-term memory system that stores general knowledge and facts about the world, as well as memory for the rules of logic that are used to deduce other facts. It involves the storage and retrieval of factual information, concepts, meanings, and relationships between items in the world.

Question 8
Givenbelow are two statements.Statement I:Carl Rogers is a proponent of non-directive model of teaching.Statement II:Rogers extended to education his view of therapy as a mode of learning.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
  • A.Both statement I and II are correct.
  • B.Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement I is correct, but statement II is incorrect.
  • D.Statement I is incorrect, but statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Both statement I and II are correct.

Option A is correct.

 

Both statements I and II are correct.

 

Statement I correctly identify Carl Rogers as a proponent of the non-directive model of teaching. Rogers emphasized the importance of student-centered approaches that prioritize individual growth and autonomy over rigid instruction.
